images.title: Bilar Man-made Forest
images.description: A two-kilometer tunnel of densely planted mahogany trees between Bilar and Loboc, creating a cool, shadowy passage known for its dramatic symmetry.

images.title: Rolling Hills of Batanes
images.description: Sweeping green hills descending toward the sea under golden skies, showcasing the peaceful and untouched landscapes of Batanes.

images.title: A Sunny Day in the Philippines
images.description: Clear turquoise skies and white clouds that highlight the Philippines as a premier tropical destination.

images.title: Historic Vigan
images.description: A UNESCO World Heritage city known for its well-preserved Spanish colonial houses, cobblestone streets, and blended architectural heritage.

images.title: Rocks by the River
images.description: A vivid nature scene featuring huge stones, clear stream waters, and lush vegetation representing the Philippines' rich biodiversity.

images.title: Aguinaldo Shrine
images.description: The ancestral home of Emilio Aguinaldo and the site of the 1898 proclamation of Philippine independence, now a museum of revolutionary artifacts.

images.description: A monument honoring the 1986 EDSA People Power Revolution, depicting the unity and strength of Filipinos in defending democracy.
